meanings.definition: The quality of being conservative in one's beliefs or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her conservativeness led her to always stick to the same routines.
meanings.sent2: The conservativeness of the town council made it resistant to new ideas.
meanings.sent3: Despite his conservativeness, he decided to try a new hobby for fun.
meanings.sent4: The conservativeness of the old oak tree symbolized the strength of tradition.
meanings.sent5: The conservativeness of the museum's curator made the exhibits timeless.

meanings.definition: The tendency to preserve or maintain existing traditions or values.
meanings.sent1: The conservativeness of the family kept their customs alive for generations.
meanings.sent2: In times of change, conservativeness can provide a sense of stability.
meanings.sent3: The conservativeness of the recipe ensured it stayed a family favorite.
meanings.sent4: His conservativeness towards history made him a guardian of the past.
meanings.sent5: The conservativeness of the town's architecture reflected its rich history.

meanings.sent1: Her conservativeness made her hesitant to try new technology.
meanings.sent2: The conservativeness of the company hindered its progress in the market.
meanings.sent3: Despite his conservativeness, he eventually embraced the new idea.
meanings.sent4: The conservativeness of the clockmaker kept his designs timeless.
meanings.sent5: The conservativeness of the town's culture resisted modern influences.
